intro: Heterogonium, commonly known as a type of green alga, is a genus within the order Ulvales. It is characterized by its thallus, which is typically a flat, ribbon-like structure that can vary in shape and size. The plant exhibits a complex life cycle involving both asexual and sexual reproduction. It thrives in marine and freshwater environments, often found on rocky substrates. Its cellular structure includes chloroplasts that enable photosynthesis, contributing to its role in aquatic ecosystems.
